tit.cmt: The links I looked at seem to suggest this is the more appropriate name but it's difficult to be sure,

sen.j: 山陰海岸国立公園（さんいんかいがんこくりつこうえん）は、京都府丹後の網野海岸から兵庫県の但馬御火浦を経て鳥取県東部の鳥取砂丘までの日本海に面する75kmの海岸線を中心とする日本の国立公園である。
sen.e: Sanin Coast National Park is a designated national park facing 75-kilometer coastline of the Japan Sea. The park includes Amino Coast in Tango region (Kyoto Prefecture), Tajima-mihonoura Inlet in Hyogo Prefecture, and Tottori-sakyu Sand Dunes in eastern Tottori Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「日本海」が有るので「日本の」を除きました。
sen.e: Sanin Kaigan National Park is a designated national park that stretches 75 km along the coast of Japan facing the Japan Sea and the park runs along the Amino Coast in the Tango region (Kyoto Prefecture), Tajima-mihonoura Inlet in Hyogo Prefecture, and Tottori-sakyu Sand Dunes in eastern Tottori Prefecture.

Sanin Kaigan National Park is a designated national park that stretches 75 km along the coast of Japan facing the Japan Sea and the park runs along the Amino Coast in the Tango region, Kyoto Prefecture, Tajima-mihonoura Inlet in Hyogo Prefecture, and Tottori-sakyu Sand Dunes in eastern Tottori Prefecture.

sen.cmt: 用語集内「人名」「歴史」のカテゴリーの「経緯」に統一しました。Web上では「経緯」ではなく「沿革 (History)」になっています。

sen.j: - 山陰海岸国定公園に指定
sen.e: - The area was designated as Sanin Coast National Park.
- The area was designated as a quasi-national park.
sen.cmt: I think the distinction being made here between 国定公園 and 国立公園 is probably important and translating both the same way will leave the reader wondering why the same thing happened twice.
sen.e: The area was designated as Sanin Kaigan Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: - 山陰海岸国立公園に指定
sen.e: - The area was designated as Sanin Coast National Park.
sen.cmt: 前列と内容が重複しています。環境省HP（http://www.env.go.jp/park/sanin/intro/basis.html)では、昭和38年(1963)に指定、となっています。
sen.e: - The area was designated as a national park.
The area was designated as Sanin Kaigan National Park.

sen.j: - 公園区域及び公園計画の全般的な見直し
sen.e: The overall park area and plan were reviewed.
The overall park area and plan were reviewed.
The overall park area and plan were reviewed.

sen.j: - 公園区域及び公園計画の変更
sen.e: The overall park area and plan were changed.
The overall park area and plan were changed.
The overall park area and plan were changed.

sen.j: - 豊岡市、香美町、新温泉町
sen.e: Toyooka City, Kami Town, and Shinonsen Town
Toyooka City, Kami Town, and Shinonsen Town

sen.j: 鳥取砂丘（日本最大の砂丘、国指定天然記念物）
sen.e: Tottori-sakyu Sand Dunes (Japan's largest dune, a state's designated natural monument)
Tottori-sakyu Sand Dunes (Japan's largest dune, a state's designated natural monument)
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。
sen.e: Tottori-sakyu Sand Dunes (Japan's largest dune, a state's designated natural monument)

sen.j: 浦富海岸（国指定名勝、日本の白砂青松100選、日本の渚100選）
sen.e: Uradome Coast (designated as 'National Site of Scenic Beauty' as well as 'Japan's 100 Best Beaches with White Sand & Blue Pine' and 'Japan's 100 Most Beautiful Beaches')
Uradome Coast (designated as National Site of Scenic Beauty, as well as Japan's 100 Best Beaches with White Sand and Blue Pine, and Japan's 100 Most Beautiful Beaches)
Uradome Coast (designated as National Site of Scenic Beauty, as well as Japan's 100 Best Beaches with White Sand and Blue Pine, and Japan's 100 Most Beautiful Beaches)

sen.j: - 千貫松島、菜種島、菜種五島、千貫松島、竜神洞、観音浦、西蓬莱島、太郎兵衛島、鴨ヶ磯海岸、黒島、白粉の断崖、水尻洞門、駱駝島、石垣島、岩燕洞門
sen.e: - Sengan-matsushima, Natanejima Island, Natane-goto, Sengan-matsushima, Ryujin Cave, Kannon-ura Inlet, Nishihoraijima Island, Tarobejima Island, Kamogaiso Rocky Shore, Kurojima Island, Oshiroi-no-dangai Cliff, Mizushiri Sea Cave, Rakuda Island, Ishigakijima Island, Iwatsubame Sea Cave
sen.cmt: 「千貫松島」の重複有り（しかしweb上も同様）。「島」は用語集に合わせましたが、整合性が有りません。「黒島」の読み方不明。
sen.e: Sengan-matsushima Rock, Natanejima Island, Natanegoto Islands, Sengan-matsushima Rock, Ryujin Cave, Kannon-ura Inlet, Nishihoraijima Island, Tarobejima Island, Kamogaiso Rocky Shore, Kurojima Island (黒島), Oshiroi-no-dangai Cliff, Mizushiri Sea Cave, Rakudajima Island, Ishigakijima Island, Iwatsubame Sea Cave

Sengan-matsushima Rock, Natanejima Island, Natanegoto Islands, Sengan-matsushima Rock, Ryujin Cave, Kannon-ura Inlet, Nishihoraijima Island, Tarobejima Island, Kamogaiso Rocky Shore, Kurojima Island (黒島), Oshiroi-no-dangai Cliff, Mizushiri Sea Cave, Rakudajima Island, Ishigakijima Island, Iwatsubame Sea Cave

sen.j: - 汐吹崎、居組県民サンビーチ、日本洞門、亀山洞門、居組白島
sen.e: - Shiofuki-zaki, Igumi Kenmin Sun Beach, Nihon-domon, Kameyama-domon, Igumi Shirashima Island
sen.cmt: ｢洞門」は用語集に合わせましたが。
sen.e: Shiofuki-zaki Cape, Igumi Kenmin San Beach, Nihon-domon Rock Cave, Kameyama-domon Rock Cave, Igumi Shirashima Island
sen.cmt: 用語補足し、表記を変えました。
sen.e: Shiofuki-zaki Cape, Igumi Kenmin San Beach, Nihon-domon Rock Cave, Kameyama-domon Rock Cave, Igumi Shirashima Island

sen.j: - 大振島、東の洞門、矢城ヶ鼻、浜坂県民サンビーチ（日本の白砂青松100選）
sen.e: - Oburi-jima Island, Higashi no Domon, Yajogahana, Hamasaka Kenmin Sun Beach (designated as 'Japan's 100 Best Beaches with White Sand & Blue Pine')
sen.cmt: ｢洞門」は用語集に合わせました。「県民サンビーチ」は「居組県民サンビーチ」に合わせました（用語集では「People Sun Beach」でした）。
sen.e: Oburijima Island, Higashi no Domon Rock Cave, Yajogahana Cape, Hamasaka Kenmin San Beach (designated as Japan's 100 Best Beaches with White Sand and Blue Pine)
Oburijima Island, Higashi no Domon Rock Cave, Yajogahana Cape, Hamasaka Kenmin San Beach (designated as Japan's 100 Best Beaches with White Sand and Blue Pine)

sen.j: 但馬御火浦（国指定名勝・天然記念物）
sen.e: Tajima-mihonoura Inlet (designated as 'National Site of Scenic Beauty' and a state's natural monument)

Tajima-mihonoura Inlet (designated as National Site of Scenic Beauty and a state's natural monument)

sen.j: - 鬼門崎、龍宮洞門、通天洞門、三尾ノ松島・三尾大島（玄武岩柱状節理の島）、十字洞門、下荒洞門、鋸岬、旭洞門、釣鐘洞門（世界最大の洞門、国指定天然記念物）、伊笹崎
sen.e: - Kimon-zaki, Ryugu Domon, Tsuten-domon, Mio no Matsushima (famous for basalt columnar joint), Juji Domon, Shitaara Domon, Nokogiri-misaki Cape, Asahi-domon, Tsurigane-domon (the world's largest cave, a state's designated natural monument), Isasa-zaki
sen.cmt: 「洞門」は用語集に合わせましたが、整合性が有りません。｢伊笹崎」読み方不明。
sen.e: Kimon-zaki Cape, Ryugu Domon Rock Cave, Tsuten-domon Rock Cave, Mio no Matsushima Island and Mio oshima Island (famous for basalt columnar joint), Juji Domon Rock Cave, Shitaara Domon Rock Cave, Nokogiri-misaki Cape, Asahi-domon Rock Cave, Tsurigane-domon Rock Cave (the world's largest cave, a state's designated natural monument), Isasa-zaki Cape

Kimon-zaki Cape, Ryugu Domon Rock Cave, Tsuten-domon Rock Cave, Mio no Matsushima Island and Mio oshima Island (famous for basalt columnar joint), Juji Domon Rock Cave, Shitaara Domon Rock Cave, Nokogiri-misaki Cape, Asahi-domon Rock Cave, Tsurigane-domon Rock Cave (the world's largest cave, a state's designated natural monument), Isasa-zaki Cape
Kasumi Coast (designated as 'National Site of Scenic Beauty')
Kasumi Coast (designated as National Site of Scenic Beauty)

sen.j: - 鎧の袖(国指定天然記念物。200mにわたる高さ65mの柱状節理の海蝕断崖),兄弟赤島,但馬松島,香住浜,白石島,黒島
sen.e: - Yoroi-no-sode ("sleeve of armor") sea cliff (designated as a state's natural monument,

Yoroi-no-sode (literally, sleeve of armor) Sea Cliff (designated as a state's natural monument, featuring 65-meter-high and 200-meter-long columnar joint), Kyodai Akajima Island, Tajima-Matsushima Island, Kasumi Beach, Shiraishijima Island, Kurojima Island (黒島)
sen.cmt: 原文が途中で分割されていたため、1文にし、表記などを変えました。
